abstract.p: Additional state funding means 12 of New Jersey's 19 community colleges can freeze tuition in 2001; other colleges and universities post 4 percent to 10 percent tuition increases (S)

block.p: Twelve of New Jersey's 19 community colleges can freeze tuition next year because of $12 million in additional funding from the state. State colleges and universities, however, have posted tuition increases ranging from 4 percent at Montclair State University to 10 percent at Rowan and Stockton universities. The money for the community colleges marks the third year of Governor Whitman's four-year pledge to increase their financing. Funding for this year topped $191 million, up 9.9 percent from last year. Bergen, Essex, Gloucester, Mercer and Middlesex county colleges face a 3 percent tuition increase.
